text: [Music]
they called him the bulldozer soldier
first politicians second RL Chiron
loomed large over 50 years of turbulent
Israeli history a hardliner
who eventually seemed to soften but
could not bring Israel peace RL Chiron
was born into a world of Jewish
pioneering zeal during Israel's original
war of independence he was already in
the army then in 1967 he led a dramatic
nighttime attack into Egypt his image as
a brilliant tactician was cemented but
there was a dark side his men were
accused of shooting Egyptian prisoners
in the 1973 war Charan actually crossed
the Suez Canal before being told to
advance no further he was angry we
defeated the Egyptians he said but
didn't finish the war then as a
politician he campaigned loudly for
Jewish settlers colonizing the occupied
territories as a new government Minister
his original aim was to prevent the
creation of a future Palestinian state
then as Minister of Defense in 1982
Charan led a full-scale invasion of
Lebanon stated aim to secure Israel's
northern border from terrorist attack
but the real priority to smash Yasser
Arafat's PLO the Israeli siege of West
Beirut caused great suffering Christian
militias close to Sharon moved into the
refugee camps of Sabra and Shatila and
slaughtered unprotected Palestinian
civilians shame Yasu an Israeli tribunal
found Ariel Sharon indirectly
responsible for the massacre and he was
sacked but Sharon clawed his way back by
the end of the 90s he was foreign
minister under Benjamin Netanyahu
he's ambition to take over the right
wing in Israeli politics led him to a
highly provocative visit to the al-aqsa
mosque
Jerusalem's Temple Mount it triggered a
Palestinian uprising but it also helped
sweep Chiron into power RL Chiron
promised Israelis peace with security
but brought neither Palestinians suicide
bombs triggered ever Harsha Israeli
punishment Chiron once again pitted
against his old foe Yasser Arafat will
he God chairman of a fad it's an enemy
Ariel Sharon spent most of his life
fighting Israel's enemies one of his
final acts was to build a barrier to
keep them out but he also adapted
politically withdrawing from the Gaza
Strip and a part of the West Bank
defying his original supporters the
Israeli settlers his eventual vision
became peace with the Palestinians and
with Israel's neighbors but strictly on
Israel's terms but then in January 2006
Prime Minister Ariel Sharon suffered a
massive stroke he went into a coma and
never recovered Ariel Sharon died with
peace still apparently a distant
prospect
